column1: The  Appellant  argued  that  neither  the  Magistrate  nor  the  High  Court

column2:
considered 
the 
affidavits,

deeds, 
and

column1: complaints filed by him, which demonstrated that:

column2: the Respondents’ deeds contained no servitude,
the disputed roadway was not depicted in his lot,
the Respondents had forcibly cleared his barbed wire fence after the
Court issued notice without an interim order, and
the Respondents had an alternative access road (Olukku Road).
